Learn how a bug was born â€” one that resulted in hundreds of users of an application getting a notification that they had been paid when in fact they had not! In this story, Haki Benita shares how a slip-up with Django signals caused him and his team quite a headache. Youâ€™ll learn how the application was architected, how the bug occurred, and how they fixed it, along with some other remedies to consider.

What does Python packaging look like in 2021? What are the best tools to use? In this article, youâ€™ll see one developerâ€™s opinion about the state of Python packaging in 2021, what tools they are using the most often, and some thoughts on how the situation can continue to improve moving forward.

June 2021 was full of notable events in the Python world! In this article, youâ€™ll get caught up on whatâ€™s been happening with Python during this past month, including some changes at the Python Software Foundation and the announcement of a new recipient of the PSF Fiscal Sponsorship Program.

Articles, Tutorials and Talks

    • REAL PYTHON
    • podcast

Are you ready to expand your Python knowledge into the intermediate to advanced territory? What tools are awaiting your discovery inside Pythonâ€™s functools module? This week on the Real Python Podcast, David Amos is back, and heâ€™s brought another batch of PyCoderâ€™s Weekly articles and projects.

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

)

  • Pyflyby: æé«˜ Jupyter äº¤äº’å¼ä¼šè¯æ•ˆç‡
    • MATTHIAS BUSSONNIER
    • AND AARON MEURER

Thereâ€™s a new tool in town that aims to improve Python developer focus and minimize distractions while coding, especially in Jupyter Notebooks. That new tool is pyflyby, and it can handle tidying up and collecting imports and exports from Python modules. For example, in a Jupyter Notebook, pyflyby can automatically import the right modules and functions from NumPy if you use something in a cell without importing it first.

  • Copilot /ç”¨ Python ç¼–å†™çš„æ–‡æœ¬æ¸¸æˆ
    • SAGINDYK URAZAYEV

GitHubâ€™s new Copilot feature has a lot of people talking. The projectâ€™s goal is to be an AI pair programmer â€” a tool that can suggest entire lines of code or even entire functions! In this amusing article, one developer who gained access to Copilotâ€™s technical preview shares how the AI wrote an entire text-based adventure game that turned out to be the solution to an exercise from a Python instructional book.

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

    • ANDRÃ‰ ROBERGE

Tracebacks are often the start of any Python debugging journey. But tracebacks can be difficult to read and confusing to beginners. The friendly-traceback project aims to lift the veil of confusion for tracebacks by providing more helpful error messages with lots of context. New updates to the project include better tracebacks in Jupyter Notebooks!

In this quick and practical course, youâ€™ll learn what a square root is and how to calculate one in Python. Youâ€™ll even see how you can use the Python square root function to solve a real-world problem.
